definition: to fill/to satisfy/to fulfill/to act in place of/substitute/sufficient/full
to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]

sentences.english: The legislation of ZSP is full of innovative characters.
sentences.chinese: 中關村立法充溢着創新性品格。

sentences.english: Can exuberant a kind of taste from inside to outside .
sentences.chinese: 可充溢着從內到外的一種味道。

sentences.english: While your feeling of appreciation is alive and sincere, act on it.
sentences.chinese: 當你心中充溢感激之情，那就行動吧。

sentences.english: Chinese mind since then are stuffed with barbarian spirit of vulgarity and shamelessness .
sentences.chinese: 中國人的樣子從當時候起就充溢了蠻橫，俗氣和無恥。

sentences.english: This Japanese Sanrio theme park is rather magical.
sentences.chinese: 日本三麗鷗主題公園是充溢神奇的地方。

sentences.chinese: 孩子們的臉上充溢着幸福的笑容。

sentences.english: Water also fills a network of small temporary lakes in the southeast.
sentences.chinese: 水流也已充溢東南面的臨時湖網。

sentences.english: At dawn, I overflow with thoughts of us.
sentences.chinese: 拂曉時，充溢着我的心令我無法入睡。

sentences.english: The smell of charcoal filters throughout their old neighborhoods.
sentences.chinese: 他們的整片老街區都充溢着炭火的氣味。

sentences.english: Buddhism believes that all bodies and mind are suffering, life is full of pain.
sentences.chinese: 佛教以爲一切身心皆苦，人生在世處處充溢着痛苦。

sentences.english: You are all imbued with the girl 's youth and pure.
sentences.chinese: 你全身充溢着少女的純情和青春的風采。

sentences.english: He filled to the passion of work, also has the humanity.
sentences.chinese: 他充溢對工作的激情，也具有人性美。

sentences.english: Once the cylinder had been filled with steam it was cooled directly by the application of cold water.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽充溢汽缸後，它會因爲冷水的溫度而直接冷卻。

definition: to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
to be full of/to flood/to congest
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)
